docs.abstract: Suspicion that terrorists used sophisticated 'end-to-end' encryption apps to coordinate Paris attacks prompts intelligence officials to reopen debate over whether to compel companies to weaken encryption technologies; Belgian authorities note that Islamic State terrorists have been hiding communications using online gaming systems in which messages are not encrypted.
docs.snippet: The attack has revived vitriolic arguments between American intelligence officials and Silicon Valley over whether the government should be given the keys to decode “end-to-end” encryption technology....

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: The attack has revived vitriolic arguments between American intelligence officials and Silicon Valley over whether the government should be given the keys to decode “end-to-end” encryption technology.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Encrypted Messaging Apps Face New Scrutiny Over Possible Role in Paris Attacks

docs.abstract: Profile of long-time Lancia engine designer Francesco De Virgilio, whose innovative design introduced more than 60 years ago is the basis for many modern 6-cylinder engines.

docs.abstract: Clear Channel Media and Entertainment, with more than 800 radio stations across the United States, says its free iHeartRadio app has enabled it to reach 50 million registered online listeners, 54 percent year-to-year increase; app works on smartphones and growing list of connected cars.
docs.snippet: Clear Channel has gained a significant audience with its streaming app, which works on smartphones and on some connected cars....
docs.lead_paragraph: Clear Channel has gained a significant audience with its streaming app, which works on smartphones and on some connected cars.

headline.main: Digital Success Comes to Radio Broadcaster
headline.print_headline: Digital Success Comes to Radio Broadcaster

docs.abstract: Today's long-haul truckers are becoming increasingly technologically connected; Web-connected devices and apps are providing information on routes and road conditions, entertainment and communication.
docs.snippet: While CB radio has not disappeared, truckers are now often connected to the Web with smartphone and tablet apps that provide diversions and lend a helping hand....
docs.lead_paragraph: While CB radio has not disappeared, truckers are now often connected to the Web with smartphone and tablet apps that provide diversions and lend a helping hand.

headline.main: Move Over, CB Radio: Trucker Apps Are Helping to Haul the Load
headline.print_headline: Move Over, CB Radio: Trucker Apps Are Helping to Haul the Load

docs.abstract: Consumers expect their cars to have the capabilities of their smartphones, so automakers have to offer a panoply of services and gadgets, commonly called telematics, that ideally keep pace with Silicon Valley.
docs.snippet: Buyers now expect their cars to have the capabilities of their smartphones, so automakers have complied. To gauge the systems, we spent time with five cars from automakers in the forefront of telematics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Buyers now expect their cars to have the capabilities of their smartphones, so automakers have complied. To gauge the systems, we spent time with five cars from automakers in the forefront of telematics.

docs.abstract: New materials, assembly processes and electronic controls make automobile repair work more challenging and training more demanding; schools have begun incorporating virtual reality teaching tools based on video game technology to teach students.
docs.snippet: New materials, assembly processes and electronic controls make automobile repair work more challenging. So how will schools train new technicians? Video game technology may provide part of the answer....
docs.lead_paragraph: New materials, assembly processes and electronic controls make automobile repair work more challenging. So how will schools train new technicians? Video game technology may provide part of the answer.

docs.snippet: A new breed of mechanics has begun hacking into car computers. Yesterday’s grease monkeys have morphed into automotive computer geeks....

docs.abstract: Navigational services company Telenav will switch from maps that are professionally produced to ones that are crowdsourced; program, called OpenStreetMap is based on information provided by amateur users who send in corrections and road changes.
docs.snippet: Telenav, a navigation services company, is switching from maps that are professionally produced to ones that are crowdsourced, using data and updates provided by contributors....
docs.lead_paragraph: Telenav, a navigation services company, is switching from maps that are professionally produced to ones that are crowdsourced, using data and updates provided by contributors.

docs.abstract: Automakers are tailoring sounds emanating from cars' exhaust pipes to more precisely define character of new models, particularly those with high-performance credentials, with help of computer modeling and mechanical gadgetry.
docs.snippet: With the help of computer modeling and mechanical gadgetry, automakers are tailoring exhaust notes to more precisely define the character of new models....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the help of computer modeling and mechanical gadgetry, automakers are tailoring exhaust notes to more precisely define the character of new models.

docs.abstract: Engineers at Porsche employed their most sophisticated knowledge of advanced materials, hybrid-electric powertrains, aerodynamics and electronics to create 918 Spyder, $846,000 gasoline-electric hybrid supercar with all-wheel drive and 4-wheel steering.
docs.snippet: The Porsche 918 Spyder, an $846,000 gasoline-electric hybrid supercar with all-wheel drive and 4-wheel steering, is what can happen when management lets its white-coated engineers run loose....
